b"#repost @steeple_squigs\n\xe3\x83\xbb\xe3\x83\xbb\xe3\x83\xbb\nBig day! Flu shot day! I got this pretty blue band-aid to prove it and I'll be showing it off the rest of the day. Go get that flu shot and snap a picture with your pretty blue band-aid and post on your stories tagging me and @riteaid and tell us who you are protecting from the flu using #gotmyshotfor. I'll repost you in my stories to keep the good momentum going! Stay safe and healthy everyone! #sponsored #flushot Click the link in our bio to learn more."

b'Make these easy, spooky @oreo bat treats with kids! :bat: These are super cute, and all you need is a knife to cut the cookie in half for the wings! :backhand_index_pointing_right: Swipe to watch how @christy_l_kitchen does it, and follow below. Get #Oreos & all things #Halloween in-store. Tap to shop or click the link in our bio.
Directions:
\xe2\x80\xa2	Take 2 Oreo cookies. 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Separate one cookie. Using a knife, cut the side without the cream filling in half for the wings and place them on top of the cream filling.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Separate the second cookie, place the top part onto the first cookie and gently press. 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Using the cream filling, apply a tiny amount on the back of a small round candy for the eye. Stick it on the cookie.'

b'Make these easy #Halloween ghost and monster treats:ghost:with kids from @christy_l_kitchen! Pick up cookie cutters, marshmallows, white chocolate and @KelloggsRiceKrispies cereal at Rite Aid! Check out our Stories to see how she does it and click the link in our bio for store locations. Directions below:

1. Melt #marshmallows and 2 tbsp butter in a pot to a a glue-like consistency
2. Slowly add a half a bag of Rice Krispies and mix it in altogether
3. Use a cookie cutter to help mold the mixture into the shape; immediately take it out of the mold and let it cool and set completely
4. Melt white and green chocolate separately and apply it on the Rice Krispie treat; let it harden. (You can also make your frosting using corn starch and sugar and then add natural food coloring or extracted vegetable juice to it.)
5.  Use white icing for the monster eyes and a bakery decorative gel to make the pupils and monster features
6. Add in mini sticks to create a marshmallow krispie pop'

b'Treat your kids to some #slime-tastic #Halloween fun at home with this simple @Starburst #DIY #recipe from our friend @its_mar_y_sol. Shop in-store for ingredients or tap here or the link in our bio for #Starburst, and get the recipe: :jack-o-lantern:
 
Ingredients:
 
1 bag (14 oz) Starburst
1/4 cup cornstarch
1/4 cup icing sugar
 
Instructions:
 
1.  Separate Starburst by color; place each in heatproof bowl. Place bowls of Starburst over saucepan of simmering water until melted.
 
2.  Whisk cornstarch with icing sugar; dust over work surface. Carefully turn out melted Starburst over top. Mixture will be hot; let cool for 5 minutes. 
 
3.  Knead melted Starburst with cornstarch mixture, pull and stretch to work air into the slime.
 
4.  Go slime crazy! Nibble or play \xe2\x80\x98til your hearts content'
